pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l1_intro: As origens de Avalon reveladas em mais um best-seller de Marion Zimmer Bradley. "As brumas de Avalon", cl√°ssica releitura do mito arturiano sob a perspectiva feminina, √© a obra-prima da autora.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l1_full: Ao longo dos anos ap√≥s a escrita do primeiro volume, Bradley se dedicou aos demais romances do chamado Ciclo de Avalon, do qual A Casa da Floresta foi o segundo t√≠tulo a ser publicado. Nos primeiros anos do Imp√©rio Romano nos territ√≥rios da Brit√¢nia, os druidas e sua religi√£o seguem duramente massacrados e perseguidos pelas legi√µes de C√©sar. Ap√≥s a destrui√ß√£o da Casa das Mulheres na sagrada ilha de Mona, as sacerdotisas, que juraram proteger os ritos ancestrais de sabedoria, cura e magia consagrados √† Deusa, buscam ref√∫gio em um novo santu√°rio: a Casa da Floresta. Mas o amor n√£o obedece √†s leis dos homens, e Eilan, futura gr√£-sacerdotisa, se apaixona por um oficial do ex√©rcito romano. E no cora√ß√£o desse romance proibido, entre o chamado e a paix√£o, entre a delicadeza do cisne e a for√ßa da √°guia, est√° a hist√≥ria da forma√ß√£o da lend√°ria ilha de Avalon.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l2_intro: O volume inicial de "O Senhor dos An√©is", lan√ßado originalmente em julho de 1954, foi o primeiro grande √©pico de fantasia moderno, conquistando milh√µes de leitores e se tornando o padr√£o de refer√™ncia para todas as outras obras do g√™nero at√© hoje.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l2_full: A Sociedade do Anel come√ßa no Condado, a regi√£o rural do oeste da Terra-m√©dia onde vivem os diminutos e pacatos hobbits. Bilbo Bolseiro, um dos raros aventureiros desse povo, cujas perip√©cias foram contadas em O Hobbit, resolve ir embora do Condado e deixa sua consider√°vel heran√ßa nas m√£os de seu jovem parente Frodo. O mais importante legado de Bilbo √© o anel m√°gico que costumava usar para se tornar invis√≠vel. No entanto, o mago Gandalf, companheiro de aventuras do velho hobbit, revela a Frodo que o objeto √© o Um Anel, a raiz do poder demon√≠aco de Sauron, o Senhor Sombrio, que deseja escravizar todos os povos da Terra-m√©dia. A √∫nica maneira de eliminar a amea√ßa de Sauron √© destruir o Um Anel nas entranhas da pr√≥pria montanha de fogo onde foi forjado.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l3_intro: Ap√≥s a morte do pai, os irm√£os Chris, Cath e os g√™meos Carrie e Cory s√£o levados pela m√£e, Corine, para o √∫nico lugar onde poderiam morar: a casa dos av√≥s, conhecida como a mans√£o Foxworth Hall.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l3_full: Enganadas achando que a nova vida seria cheia de luxos e sonhos realizados, as crian√ßas n√£o imaginavam que os av√≥s as consideravam frutos do dem√¥nio. Tamb√©m n√£o sabiam que seus pais eram parentes de sangue, "tio e sobrinha", e que haviam cometido um pecado ao se casarem e terem filhos. Por isso que, segundo a av√≥, tais aberra√ß√µes deveriam ser trancadas num pequeno quartinho na ala norte. J√° no dia seguinte a chegada, Corine est√° no quarto olhando para o pai debilitado, quando sua m√£e a chicoteia 17 vezes como castigo por seus dezessete anos de casada.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l4_intro: Na inf√¢ncia, Danny Torrance sobreviveu a uma tentativa de homic√≠dio por parte do pai, um escritor perturbado pelos esp√≠ritos malignos do Hotel Overlook.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l4_full: J√° adulto, traumatizado e alco√≥latra. Danny se estabelece em uma pequena cidade, onde consegue um emprego no hospital local. Sua paz, por√©m, est√° com os dias contados a partir de quando cria um v√≠nculo telep√°tico com Abra, uma menina com poderes t√£o fortes quanto aqueles que ele bloqueia dentro de si."
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l5_intro: Em seu romance de estr√©ia, o escritor italiano Donato Carrisi surpreendeu e arrebatou a cr√≠tica e o p√∫blico ao embrenhar-se por um g√™nero at√© ent√£o fortemente atribu√≠do aos grandes escritores americanos.
pt.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l5_full: Presente nas listas de best sellers dos principais jornais da It√°lia logo em seu lan√ßamento, com mais de 180 mil exemplares vendidos e publicado em nove pa√≠ses, O aliciador √© mais que um thriller de um autor estreante que reinventa as regras do jogo: √© uma hist√≥ria que n√£o d√° tr√©gua, que explora a zona nebulosa entre o bem e o mal at√© descobrir seu √∫ltimo segredo, seu menor sussurro. O criminologista Goran Gavila e a equipe de homic√≠dios enfrentam um caso perturbador, que exige toda a habilidade dos policiais do Esquadr√£o Especial: seis bra√ßos direitos s√£o desenterrados em um bosque, cinco meninas entre 9 e 13 anos est√£o desaparecidas.

pt.multimind.about.title: Sobre o Projeto

A solu√ß√£o utiliza a API Gemini da Google para gerar respostas completas, test√°veis e com refer√™ncias confi√°veis, baseadas em WCAG e ARIA.

en.meta_description: Portfolio of Joelma Ferreira, a Quality Engineering Lead. Specialist in test automation, QA, and digital accessibility (a11y).
en.about_bio1: Software Quality professional with over 4 years of experience, having worked at Grupo P√£o de A√ß√∫car. My journey includes manual and automation testing with Java and JavaScript, as well as CI/CD pipelines.
en.about_bio2: I currently lead the quality area in the FIC team, promoting excellence in testing, automation, inclusion, and digital accessibility. I also contribute to the QA chapter, sharing knowledge and practices with other teams.
en.about_bio3: My work combines strategy, empathy, and technique‚Äîensuring products with quality, accessibility, and real impact for people.
en.skill_cicd_item2: Monitoring with SonarQube, Grafana, and Kibana
en.project_bookshelf_desc: A page that simulates a virtual bookshelf. Created with semantic HTML and CSS, focusing on accessible structure and responsive design.
en.project_florist_desc: Institutional website with dynamic data, JS form validation, and a focus on accessibility (A11y).
en.project_mario_desc: A simple game demonstrating DOM manipulation and keyboard events with vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
en.project_card_desc: An interactive card with a flip effect using only HTML and CSS 3D transforms.
en.project_multimind_desc: A multi-agent chatbot using the Gemini API for accessibility and software quality validation.
en.project_future_desc: News on the way! A new project is under development.

en.project_bookshelf_read_more: Read the rest of the synopsis
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l1_intro: The origins of Avalon are revealed in another bestseller by Marion Zimmer Bradley. 'The Mists of Avalon,' a classic retelling of the Arthurian myth from a female perspective, is the author's masterpiece.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l1_full: Over the years following the writing of the first volume, Bradley dedicated herself to the other novels of the so-called Avalon Cycle, of which 'The Forest House' was the second title to be published. In the early years of the Roman Empire in the territories of Britain, the druids and their religion are harshly massacred and persecuted by Caesar's legions. After the destruction of the House of Women on the sacred island of Mona, the priestesses, who swore to protect the ancestral rites of wisdom, healing, and magic consecrated to the Goddess, seek refuge in a new sanctuary: the Forest House. But love does not obey the laws of men, and Eilan, a future high priestess, falls in love with a Roman army officer. And at the heart of this forbidden romance, between duty and passion, between the delicacy of the swan and the strength of the eagle, lies the story of the formation of the legendary island of Avalon.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l2_intro: The initial volume of 'The Lord of the Rings,' originally released in July 1954, was the first great modern fantasy epic, captivating millions of readers and becoming the benchmark for all other works in the genre to this day.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l2_full: The Fellowship of the Ring begins in the Shire, a rural region in the west of Middle-earth where the small, peaceful hobbits live. Bilbo Baggins, one of the rare adventurers of this people, whose exploits were told in 'The Hobbit,' decides to leave the Shire and leaves his considerable inheritance in the hands of his young relative Frodo. Bilbo's most important legacy is the magic ring he used to become invisible. However, the wizard Gandalf, a companion in the old hobbit's adventures, reveals to Frodo that the object is the One Ring, the root of the demonic power of Sauron, the Dark Lord, who wishes to enslave all the peoples of Middle-earth. The only way to eliminate the threat of Sauron is to destroy the One Ring in the depths of the very mountain of fire where it was forged.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l3_intro: After their father's death, siblings Chris, Cath, and twins Carrie and Cory are taken by their mother, Corine, to the only place they could live: their grandparents' house, known as Foxworth Hall.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l3_full: Deceived into thinking the new life would be full of luxuries and fulfilled dreams, the children did not imagine their grandparents considered them fruits of the devil. They also did not know that their parents were blood relatives, 'uncle and niece,' and had committed a sin by marrying and having children. That is why, according to the grandmother, such 'abominations' should be locked in a small room in the north wing. The very next day after their arrival, Corine is in the room looking at her ailing father when her mother whips her 17 times as punishment for her seventeen years of marriage.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l4_intro: In his childhood, Danny Torrance survived an attempted murder by his father, a writer disturbed by the evil spirits of the Overlook Hotel.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l4_full: Now an adult, traumatized and an alcoholic, Danny settles in a small town where he gets a job at the local hospital. His peace, however, is short-lived when he forms a telepathic bond with Abra, a girl with powers as strong as those he blocks within himself."
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l5_intro: In his debut novel, Italian writer Donato Carrisi surprised and captivated critics and the public by delving into a genre previously strongly attributed to great American writers.
en.project_bookshelf_synopsis_l5_full: Featured on the bestseller lists of major Italian newspapers upon its release, with over 180,000 copies sold and published in nine countries, 'The Whisperer' is more than just a thriller from a debut author who reinvents the rules of the game: it is a relentless story that explores the nebulous zone between good and evil until it uncovers its last secret, its smallest whisper. Criminologist Goran Gavila and the homicide team face a disturbing case that demands all the skill of the Special Squad officers: six right arms are unearthed in a forest, and five girls between 9 and 13 are missing.

en.multimind.title: Accessibility Chatbot (MultiMind QA)
en.multimind.subtitle: An intelligent assistant with a multi-agent architecture to answer questions about digital accessibility.
en.multimind.about.title: About the Project
en.multimind.about.description: This project is an accessible and educational chatbot aimed at professionals, developers, and QA teams who want to clarify doubts about digital accessibility. The solution uses Google's Gemini API to generate complete, testable responses with reliable references, based on WCAG and ARIA.
en.multimind.features.title: Key Features
en.multimind.features.item2: Technical validation based on WCAG and ARIA
en.multimind.tech.title: Technologies Used
